title: Thunderbird 102 will not show clickable hyperlinks
content:
Within my received emails, obvious hyperlinks are not displayed as hyperlinks and can not be clicked to go to the link in Edge web browser.

Randy

title: Receiving emails
content:
Hi everyone. I am not computer savvy. My IT guru has kindly set up my Thunderbird platform so I can receive and view my emails from two different accounts. The problem I'm finding is that emails from both accounts are turning up in my gmail inbox. Also spam is not being filtered. Any help and advice you could give me would be greatly appreciated. Also there is a folder called "All Mail" it has over 11,000 emails in it. If I empty it will the emails still be in my inboxes? I've been too scared to do it in fear of losing all emails. Thank you in advance.

Jen
creator: rjwrev

title: unable to send outgoing mail
content:
anybody know what is going on here please?


554 Nemesis ESMTP Service not available Transaction failed Reject due to policy restrictions.

Please note that, if your email header is not RFC 5321 and RFC 5322 compliant, your message will be rejected by our system.

This includes the following: 

   The following email headers included in your message must be syntactically correct: Date, From, Sender, To    The following headers included in your email must be limited to just one each: BCC, CC, Date, From, Sender, Subject, To

Therefore, we would advise you to check that the above mentioned information provided by your system is correct. Should you need additional support, please contact your System Administrator.
creator: rob.hingley

title: Various:  Mostly Passwords; 32 vs 64 Bit; Number of Accounts
content:
Having searched for answers without success, I come here - hat in hand - [s]asking /sbegging for help.

First, which version of TB should I be running, 32 or 64 bit? Why?

Second, TB continues to vex me with password management. It's my impression that it changes passwords for accounts on its own, although I know that is unlikely if not impossible. Furthermore, it hides where it stores passwords from me. KB articles are no help because they reference menu choices that do not appear in version 114.12.0 64-bit.

Can someone, please, give me instructions for finding and changing passwords in TB. My ISP is sending me messages that PW authentication failed. I finally figured out the navigation to change PWs at my ISP but I cannot find the same in TB. Before you ask, I store my mail account PWs in a PW manager so that I can recall the last used PW when I encounter these problems.

Third, does anyone know if there is a limit in TB on the number of accounts it will manage? I'm having trouble adding accounts despite following the procedures for doing so and receiving confirmation that they have been added; yet they do not appear in the list of accounts in the window at the left of the screen.
creator: rabbithutch1

title: Your Thunderbird profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible.
content:
Hello,

"Your Thunderbird profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible".

New installation of Windows 11. Installed Thunderbird 102 and did some setting up. I must have made a bad choice as I now get the above error message and cannot open Thunderbird. I have uninstalled TB and reinstalled but to no effect.

Help and advice very gratefully received.

Regards

I thought I could "search" and find all messages from one sender and try to delete them en masse, but don't know how to do that. There are thousands that need to be deleted. No maintenance has been done for many years. I hope someone can help. Thanks in advance.

title: setup and connect to mutliple IMAP servers?
content:
While searching for ways to migrate a legacy email account to Thunderbird, it occurs to me that I can connect to the legacy system via IMAP and "archive" the desired messages via Thunderbird.

But, I cannot readily see how to create multiple profiles, if that is the proper term, to allow connection to more than a single IMAP server/account.

Is there a way? Multiple installs of Thunderbird?

title: outgoing mail problem
content:
Hi guys!

I get this message when trying to send outgoing mail. I have just installed on a new laptop. Works fine off the old laptop. here's the message I am getting from my email server:


554 Nemesis ESMTP Service not available Transaction failed Reject due to policy restrictions.

Please note that, if your email header is not RFC 5321 and RFC 5322 compliant, your message will be rejected by our system.

This includes the following: 

   The following email headers included in your message must be syntactically correct: Date, From, Sender, To    The following headers included in your email must be limited to just one each: BCC, CC, Date, From, Sender, Subject, To

Therefore, we would advise you to check that the above mentioned information provided by your system is correct. Should you need additional support, please contact your System Administrator.


meanwhile incoming mail is working fine so perhaps some configuration error on outgoing mail?

my address is rob.hingley@gmx.com

cheers
creator: rob.hingley

I've also disable and enable the message preview on the Settings of Thunderbird, but it is not working.

title: Email recover - Accidentally clicked clear disk space
content:
I accidentally clicked „clear disk space“ thinking that this will compact the emails and make some more space but instead this deleted all my important work emails. I have tried lots of things like trying to recover them and checking in the bin/ trash folder but I can’t seem to recover them. Interestingly it is still showing the same amount of space as before I „deleted“ all my emails.

Appreciate every little tips or help! Thanks!

title: Sent mails are duplicated
content: Hi, Every time I send an email I got a duplicate in sent mail. I have several accounts but this happens only on a single outlook365 account. "place a copy.." option is unticked but there is something weird, since differently from the other accounts I have, the entries are not greyed out. If I tick and untick the option, the entries became greyed but if I close and re-open the window setting they are not greyed anymore. Thunderbird version is 102.12.0 on Windows 10 and the behaviour also occurs in troubleshoot mode. I have other 2 office365 accounts configured but none of them have this problem. Any help ?

title: Maximum number of connections from user-IP exceeded (IMAP)
content:
All of a sudden one of my email accounts stopped connecting to the IMAP server producing a message about faulty setting or an incorrect password. I checked all settings, deleted and reestablished the account (including deleting the profile) several times to no avail.

When I try to use the account with other clients such as Opera Mail or Evolution I get the error message: Maximum number of connections from user-IP exceeded (mail_max_userip_connections=25), which means that I somehow have overloaded the IMAP server. That is strange, since I the maximum number of connections I can use is three (one of two stationaries, one mobile device and the webmail service).

My service provider is not of much help, saying the error is due to my client (Thunderbird) og something else in my end. The only advice the have is to check the settings and change password.

I have two account on the same domain with the same provider and only one of them is affected by the error.

How do I solve this?
creator: morten7

title: Trouble seeing events using thunderbird calendar with caldav connecting to sogo server
content:
I've got an iRedmail sogo server, and use it with the sogo web interface, but thunderbird doesn't work correctly with it. I add calendar items for my sogo caldav connection and no events are visible, yet the event is saved in my sogo server (and appears on my iphone). I am using thunderbird version 102.12.0 x64 windows 10.

I have similar problems with the cardav components of thunderbird. Is it possible that this is a sogo issue or thunderbird?
creator: craig92

title: Saving passwords
content: I cannot get Thunderbird to store my email passwords. I just upgraded to 102.12.0 (64 bit) on a new Win 11 machine, from 59.9.1 (32 bit) on an old Win Vista machine. I transferred my profiles, and neither Thunderbird or Firefox are saving entered passwords. I am getting the prompts asking if I want to save, and am responding yes. I have McAfee LiveSafe, V. 1.10.231, RelN 16.0 R110, Afid 977
